channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024030218
item.description:
Report E-2024030218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill was discovered on the dock in Oklahoma City, OK. The spill consists of (4) 1 gallon plastic cans of Sea Foam Motor Treatment (UN1993), which were found punctured inside of the cardboard box they were shipped in, spilling approximately 1 cup into the box and the containers. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will place the box and containers into a 20 gallon poly drum for disposal. The waste was left onsite for the terminal manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030211
item.description:
Report X-2024030211

  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found by VSA, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Package appears to be leaking due to having cracked lid. Package is also undeclared. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.
